entry.title: gyōji
entry.content: ... that since 2022, gyōji can be seen wearing Pokémon-inspired kimonos (example pictured) in the ring to celebrate the 25th anniversary of Pokémon Red and Blue?

entry.title: Marie Catharine Neal
entry.content: ... that Marie Catharine Neal, an expert on Hawaiian plants, authored the acclaimed book In Gardens of Hawaii in 1948, which described more than 2,000 species with detailed scientific information and illustrations?

entry.title: Sanusi
entry.content: ... that Indonesian politician Sanusi's parents discouraged him from becoming a government employee, because his salary would be paid partly from taxes on alcohol and prostitution?

entry.title: selected to the Pro Bowl
entry.content: ... that Barry Sanders was the first player to play at least ten seasons in the National Football League and be selected to the Pro Bowl in each year?

entry.title: Ilie Purcaru
entry.content: ... that Ilie Purcaru, as a contributor to Nicolae Ceaușescu's cult of personality, claimed that a young Ceaușescu had walked into the woods of Scornicești without fearing their wolves?

entry.title: Lord Chamberlain's plays
entry.content: ... that the Lord Chamberlain's plays are a historical archive of play scripts curated through theatrical censorship that provide a unique insight into attitudes to race and sexuality?

entry.title: Elizabeth Seifert
entry.content: ... that Elizabeth Seifert, who was denied a medical degree due to her gender, went on to achieve success as a writer, penning more than 80 novels about the very field from which she had been excluded?

entry.title: What a Devastating Turn of Events
entry.content: ... that Rachel Chinouriri decided to include the English flag on the cover art of What a Devastating Turn of Events to celebrate her Black British identity?

entry.title: Bill McNulty
entry.content: ... that when the Oakland Athletics promoted Bill McNulty to the major leagues, they needed forest rangers to find him?
